titles.title: Gädlä ḥawaryat, Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Gädlä ḥawaryat, Apocryphal Acts of the Apostles (fols. 1va-169va) I-1) Introduction (fol. 1va-vb) I-2) The Preaching of St. Bartholomew (fols. 3ra-3vb, 36ra-36vb, 4ra-9rb) I-3) The Martyrdom of St. Bartholomew (fols. 9rb-12rb) I-4) The Acts of St. Matthew (fols. 12va-18vb, 24ra-26rb) I-5) The Acts of Sts. Andrew and Bartholomew (fols. 20va-23vb, 142ra-142vb, 34ra-35vb, 116ra-116vb, 46ra-49vb, 117ra-117vb, 101ra-103vb, 146ra-147vb) I-6) The Martyrdom of St. Matthew (fols. 26rb-28vb) I-7) The Martyrdom of St. Luke (fols. 28vb-32va) I-8) The Preaching of St. Philip (fols. 32vb, 112ra-115vb, 33ra-rb), incomplete I-9) The Martyrdom of St. Philip (fols. 33rb-33vb, 143ra-143vb, 37ra-38ra) I-10) The Preaching of St. Andrew (fols. 38ra-43vb, 45ra-45vb, 44ra-44vb, 19ra-20va) I-11) The Martyrdom of St. James the Son of Zebedee (fols. 53va-55rb) I-12) The Martyrdom of St. Mark the Evangelist (fols. 55va-59vb) I-13) The Preaching of St. Thomas (fols. 59vb-63vb, 81ra-82vb, 64ra-71ra) I-14) The Martyrdom of St. Thomas (fols. 71rb-76ra) I-15) The Preaching of St. Judas Thaddeus (fols. 76ra-80vb, 88ra-88va) I-16) The Preaching of St. Peter (fols. 88va-vb, 83ra-87vb, 89ra-94vb) I-17) The Martyrdom of St. Peter (fols. 94vb-97rb) I-18) The Martyrdom of St. Paul (fols. 97rb-99vb) I-19) The Preaching of St. Simon the son of Cleopas, surnamed Judas or Nathaniel (fols. 100ra-100vb, 104ra-vb) I-20) The Martyrdom of St. Simon the son of Cleopas, surnamed Judas or Nathaniel (fols. 104vb-106ra) I-21) The Preaching of St. James the Just (fols. 106ra-107vb) I-22) The Martyrdom of St. James the Just (fols. 107vb-111rb) I-23) The Acts of St. Matthias and St. Andrew (fols. 111va-vb, 158ra-169rb) I-24) The Death of St. John the Son of Zebedee (fols. 130rb-136rb) I-25) The Martyrdom of St. James the Son of Alphaeus (fols. 136rb-137rb) I-26) The Preaching of St. Matthias (fols. 137rb-141vb, 150ra-154vb), incomplete I-27) The Martyrdom of St. Andrew (fols. 146vb-149vb) I-28) The Acts of St. John the Son of Zebedee (fols. 149vb, 118ra-122vb, 124ra-126vb, 123ra-123vb, 127ra-130rb), incomplete I-29) The Martyrdom of St. Matthew (fols. 154vb-157rb) I-30) The Acts of St. James the Son of Zebedee (fols. 157rb-vb, 50ra-53rb)
Additiones 1-2; colophon.

owners.owner: Täsfa Ḥawaryat is mentioned as commissioner of the Ms. in a supplication on fol. 99v and in the colophon.

dcomments.dcomment: 29 year of mercy (= 1377 A.D.), s. colophon.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. is in poor condition. Both boards are missing; the sewing is heavily damaged (for the most part missing) and crudely repaired; a synthetic material is used to cover the spine. Several fols. are missing and many others misplaced. The Ms. has been affected by humidity. Several fols. are damaged by rodents. Cuts crudely repaired on fols. 2 and 103. Many fols. have irregular size.

bindings.binding: Boards are missing. Two pairs of sewing stations.

squires.squire: The quire structure cannot be identified due to the poor condition of the Ms.

taunit.ln-info: the number of lines varies from 26 to 37/38 (in fols. 158ra-169rb)
taunit.rl-info:
Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written below the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.
A ruled line has left empty by the scribe at the bottom of fol. 111rb. The ruling is not always uniform and regular.

ptypeofscripts.ptypeofscript: Second half of the XIV century.

rubrications.rubrication: Some lines (3-5) alternating with black lines, in the incipit of each text (both columns for Texts I-2 and I-23); sometimes the first lines of the account proper; Ethiopic numerals; elements of the punctuation signs and caesura signs (crux ansata and coronis).

otherdetails.otherdetail:
For each text, the equivalent pages of Budge's Edition (BConAp I, II) and the abbreviations used by Bausi in Annali 2000-2001 are given here following: I-1) BConAp I, 3-6; BConAp II, 2-3; Int in BauGaH I-2) BConAp I, 83-92; BConAp II, 76-86; Ba1 in BauGaH I-3) BConAp I, 93-100; BConAp II, 87-92; Ba2 in BauGaH I-4) BConAp I, 101-113; BConAp II, 93-108; Mt1 in BauGaH I-5) BConAp I, 156-83; BConAp II, 154-80; AnB in BauGaH I-6) BConAp I, 114-18; BConAp II, 109-14; Mt2 in BauGaH I-7) BConAp I, 119-25; BConAp II, 115-21; Luc in BauGaH I-8) BConAp I, 126-34; BConAp II, 122-30; Ph1 in BauGaH I-9) BConAp I, 135-39; BConAp II, 131-36; Ph2 in BauGaH I-10) BConAp I, 140-56; BConAp II, 137-53; An1 in BauGaH I-11) BConAp I, 254-57; BConAp II, 253-56; JZ2 in BauGaH I-12) BConAp I, 257-64; BConAp II, 257-64; Mar in BauGaH I-13) BConAp I, 265-87; BConAp II, 265-86; Th1 in BauGaH I-14) BConAp I, 287-95; BConAp II, 287-95; Th2 in BauGaH I-15) BConAp I, 296-306; BConAp II, 296-306; Jud in BauGaH I-16) BConAp I, 7-36; BConAp II, 5-25; Pt1 in BauGaH I-17) BConAp I, 37-41, 45-49; BConAp II, 26-34; Pt2 in BauGaH I-18) BConAp I, 41-45; BConAp II, 26-34; Pa1 in BauGaH I-19) BConAp I, 67-70; BConAp II, 58-61; Si1 in BauGaH I-20) BConAp I, 70-72; BConAp II, 62-64; Si2 in BauGaH I-21) BConAp I, 73-76; BConAp II, 65-68; Jc1 in BauGaH I-22) BConAp I, 76-82; BConAp II, 69-75; Jc2 in BauGaH I-23) BConAp I, 307-35; BConAp II, 307-34; MAn in BauGaH I-24) BConAp I, 214-22; BConAp II, 212-20; Jo2 in BauGaH I-25) BConAp I, 223-24; BConAp II, 221-22; JcA in BauGaH I-26) BConAp I, 225-42; BConAp II, 223-40; Ma1 in BauGaH I-27) BConAp I, 184-88; BConAp II, 181-85; An2 in BauGaH I-28) BConAp I, 189-213; BConAp II, 186-211; Jo1 in BauGaH I-29) BConAp I, 114-18; BConAp II, 109-14; Mt2 in BauGaH I-30) BConAp I, 247-53; BConAp II, 246-52; JZ1 in BauGaH.
- Text I-8: text missing after fol. 115vb and before fol. 33ra = BConAp I, 131 l.22-133 l.14. Text I-26: text missing after fol. 141vb and before fol. 150ra = BConAp I, 233 l.2-234 l.19. Text I-28: text missing after fol. 149vb and before fol. 118ra = BConAp I 189 l.12-192 l.24.
- Fol. 100ra (l.1): unidentified. - According to the distribution of the texts, the Gädlä ḥawaryat of AQG-010 would belong to II recension (cp. BauGaH, 83-84). Text I-17, the Martyrdom of St. Peter, does not contain the "Discourse of Peter on the Cross" (= BConAp I, 45-49; BConAp II, 30-34). - Fol. 1r: text (main text? addition?) unidentified. - Between fol. 157v and fol. 158r, a fol. is missing (only a part of it is visible). - Subscriptiones in fols. 99v, 169vb. In fol. 99v: mention of the commissioner of the Ms., Täsfa Ḥawaryat (s. also "Colophon"). - The invocation from the scribe, ስረዩ፡ ወባርኩኒ፡ (“forgive[me] and bless me”), has been written after the text in fols. 2vb and 12rb. - The scribe tends to start a new paragraph (after the four dots or nine dots asterisks) on the new ruled line.

colophon.col: Fol. 169va: ወተፅሕ[ፈ]ት፡ ዛቲ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ በ፳ወ፱፡ ዓመተ፡ ምሕረት፡ እንዘ፡ ንጉሥነ፡ ው[ድ]ም፡ ወጳጳስነ፡ አባ፡ ሰላማ፡ ወመኰንን፡ [ዴ]ራስጐኒ፡ ወዐቃቤ፡ ሰዓት፡ <...> ወለእመ፡ ቦዘተኃየላ፡ ወዘተአጋላ፡ እመሂ፡ መኰንን፡ ወእመዚ፡  ስዩም፡ ውጉዛ፡ ለይኩን፡ በአፈ፡ ፲ወ፪ሐዋርያት፡ …
colophon.det: The note states that the Ms. was written in 29 year of mercy (= 1377 A.D., cp. ChChron 161) and during the time of King Wǝdǝm and of Metropolitan ʾabba Sälama and of governor Derasgwänä (?). It is not clear if this note is the colophon of the Ms. or of the work. King Wǝdǝm probably is king Wǝdǝm Asfäre, the regnal name of king Nǝwayä Maryam, who was on the throne from 1371 to 1380 (cp. EAE III, 1175). ʾAbba Sälama must be ʾabba Sälama “the Translator”, the Metropolitan of the Ethiopian Church from 1348 (or 1350) to 1388 (or 1390) (cp. EAE IV, 488-89). At the end, mention of the commissioner, Täsfa Ḥawaryat, and of the name of the church, ʾAdd Qwǝlqwal (a part of this note has been erased).

additional.cont: Fol. 99v: Ownership note.
additional.add: Fol. 99v: ገድለ፡ ሐዋርያት፡ ዘአድ፡ ቍልቋል፡
additional.tran: Fol. 99v: Gädlä Ḥawaryat of (the church of) ˀAdd Qwǝlqwal.

additional.cont: Fol. 169vb: Hymn in praise of God.
additional.det: Written in a faded ink, in a 16th-cent. (?) hand.

extras.extra: - In fol. 39v, number ፶ (cue for the rubricator) is written in the left margin of column b, repeating the same (rubricated) number in the text column. - Erasures, e.g., on fols. 54rb, 56va, 77va, 66va, 70vb, 77rb. - Corrections (omitted words or letters) written interlineally, e.g., on fols. 40ra, 53vb, 137va, 138va. - Crude notes and doodles in pen or in pencil, e.g., in fols. 1r, 2r, 9r, 54r, 138r, 139r, 150r, 170v; crude drawings on fols. 2v and 170v. - Personal names crudely written (in pen or in a faded ink) on fols. 1vb (below the text), 53rb (below the text), 169v (below the text) and 170r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Readings are indicated by the commemoration dates, written in the same hand, in red, in the upper margin: አመ፲፪፡ ለጥቅመ[sic]ት፡: fol. 12v አመ፡ ፳ወ፪፡ ለጥቅምት: fol. 28v አመ፡ ፰፡ ለኅዳር: fol. 32v አመ፡ ፬፡ ለታኅሣሥ፡: fol. 38r በማርቆስ፡ ምንባብ፡ fol. 55v አመ፡ ፳፮(?)፡ ለግንቦት፡: fol. 59v አመ፡ ፪፡ ለኀምሌ፡: fol. 76r አመ፡ ፭፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ ወጳውሎስ፡: fol. 88v አመ፡ ፲ለኀምሌ፡: fol. 100r አመ፡ ፲ወ፰፡ ወኀምሌ፡: fol. 106r አመ፡ ፴፡ ለነሓሲ[sic]፡: fol. 111v አመ፡ ፲፡ ለየካቲት፡: fol. 136r አመ፡ ፰፡ ለመጋቢት፡: fol. 137r አመ፡ ፬፡ ለጥር፡: fol. 149v.

frames.frame: Fol. 3r (incipit of Text I-2): coloured (red, yellow, green, black) ornamental band (interlaces).
